channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Two gunmen are shot dead by armed worshipper as they tried to rob a congregation in South Africa
item.description: The men were shot by Pieter van der Westhuizen, a congregant and the brother of South African rugby union player Joost van der Westhuizen at Querencia Ministries church in Centurion.

item.title: Holiday makers face 'summer of uncertainty' over Spanish quarantine decision
item.description: NHS worker Peter Anderson, 49, returning from Marbella, believes he would be eligible to go straight back to work but instead faces taking two weeks off because of his wife Gaynor's job.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'face PERMANENT exile from the Royal Family'
item.description: The couple have 'torpedoed' any chance of creating a new position with the help of the Queen and senior royals when their 'trial period' in the US ends, sources believe.

item.title: Britain's coronaphobia means the economy could take FIVE YEARS to recover
item.description: Experts at big four consultancy firm EY said that they expect gross domestic product (GDP) to remain below where it was in 2019 until 2024, dealing a blow to hopes of a rapid recovery.

item.title: Prince Harry's ex Cressida Bonas marries Harry Wentworth-Stanley in private ceremony
item.description: Prince Harry's ex-girlfriend Cressida Bonas has married her fiancé Harry Wentworth-Stanley in a private ceremony. The Winchester-born actress, 31, tied the knot this weekend.

item.title: Queen will be 'person most upset' by bombshell biography Finding Freedom.' source claims
item.description: The Queen will be the person 'most upset' about new bombshell biography Finding Freedom, a family source has claimed, speaking to Vanity Fair. They added it will 'open wounds.'

item.title: Travel industry fears wave of cancellations after Government's Spain decision
item.description: The travel industry is braced for a wave of cancellations by worried holidaymakers this morning after the Government reimposed quarantine restrictions on Spain.

item.title: Happy or infuriated? Handy new chart reveals how 32 emotions appear from behind a mask
item.description: The handy new chart, created by the team at Uncrowd, reveals what 32 emotions look like from behind a mask. It comes after new laws made face coverings mandatory in all shops in England.

item.title: Gold hits its highest price ever at £1,515 an ounce amid fears of coronavirus and US-China tensions
item.description: With US-China relations deteriorating, Covid-19 cases spiking and Washington slow to agree a stimulus bill, gold is seen as a safe haven for investors amid such times of turmoil.

item.title: Leading organisations sign Mentally Healthy Football Declaration after Heads Up campaign
item.description: Football's leading organisations have joined forces to sign a Declaration committing to make mental health a priority at all levels of the game, as a legacy of the Heads Up campaign.

item.title: Why do British visitors to Ibiza still have to quarantine?
item.description: The Foreign and Commonwealth Office has advised UK travellers against all non-essential travel including holidays to mainland Spain, but this does not apply to the Canary or Balearic Islands.

item.title: Yob who mowed down grandfather, 67, and his four-year-old granddaughter jailed for two years
item.description: Jordan Fisher, 28, has been jailed for two years after he drove into the family at Warren House Park in Doncaster, South Yorkshire. The little girl can be heard sobbing in a video of the attack.

item.title: Holiday and airline stocks tumble due to fears of further travel restrictions
item.description: Airline and travel stocks are the top fallers amid fears of further travel restrictions after the UK Government's decision to impose a 14-day quarantine on travellers arriving from Spain.

item.title: Mass brawl in Sheffield sees men and women hurl bricks, planks and garden chairs at each other
item.description: Amid the chaos in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, on Saturday afternoon a topless man can be seen trying to fend off someone hitting him with a piece of wood and a woman throws a brick.

item.title: Small plane crashes in Brazil onto busy street narrowly missing cars and a pedestrian
item.description: Pilot Fábio Reis, 35, and his passenger, Alessandro Cunhago, 33, were able to crawl out of the wreckage after their plane crashed onto a road in Guabiruba, Brazil, following a suspected engine failure.

item.title: Roger Ailes' widow's last words to him were 'I forgive you', she reveals in new movie on his life
item.description: A new movie entitled Man in the Arena on Fox founder Roger Ailes' life will be released Friday in which his widow Elizabeth reveals her last words to him were 'I forgive you'.

item.title: China records highest new COVID-19 cases since April
item.description: The bulk of 57 new domestic cases were found in the far northwestern Xinjiang region, where a sudden outbreak in the regional capital of Urumqi occurred in mid-July.
item.media:description: China has recorded 61 new coronavirus cases -- the highest daily figure since April -- propelled by clusters in three separate regions

item.title: Boris Johnson launches Government's new anti-obesity drive
item.description: Boris Johnson today admitted he was 'too fat' when he was hospitalised with coronavirus as the Prime Minister launched the Government's new anti-obesity drive.

item.title: Wheelchair-bound fiancée of slain BLM protester leads vigil in Austin
item.description: Whitney Mitchell, 28, the fiancee of slain Black Lives Matter protester Garrett Foster, also 28, led marchers in a vigil for him in Austin on Sunday night, at the spot where he was shot dead a day earlier.

item.title: Home in need of a refresh? Here are the hottest interiors trends for 2020
item.description: We've all been spending a lot more time at home and while summer is here and we can be out and about a lot more, we're definitely ready to show our homes a little love.

item.title: Kim Jong Gun: North Korean generals pose like gangsters alongside their leader with pistols
item.description: On the 67th anniversary of the 1953 Korean War armistice, North Korea released pictures of Kim Jong Un surrounded by army generals posing with pistols awarded to them to mark the occasion.
item.media:credit: KCNA VIA KNS/AFP via Getty Image

item.title: BLM demonstrator dubbed 'Naked Athena' is a sex worker in her 30s
item.description: The woman, whose naked poses in front of a row of federal officers attracted global attention, revealed she is a sex worker in her thirties named Jen.

item.title: Bugatti's 'Baby II' is a 75% replica of the 1920s Type 35 racer
item.description: Those wanting the top of the range 'Pur Sang' model will have to shell out €58,500 (£53,000) to the Volkswagen-owned French firm.

item.title: Horrific ordeal of schoolgirl, 13, who was mocked in the playground with cries of 'Abortion!'
item.description: Daniel Maughan, 29, from Heywood, near Rochdale, who admitted rape and assault at Minshull Street Crown Court, forced himself on the schoolgirl during a sleepover she had been invited to in 2018.

item.title: Kate Middleton sent flowers to Meghan Markle as a 'peace offering'
item.description: According to Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl, Kate Middleton, 38, sent flowers to Meghan Markle, 38, as a 'peace offering' but the Duchess of Sussex said 'in no uncertain terms' that the gift 'was not enough'.

item.title: Widow sues BBC for £800k claiming husband's cancer was caused by asbestos inhaled on sets as a child
item.description: The widow of movie actor Graham Fletcher-Cook is suing the BBC in the high court and asking for £800k in compensation after he died of asbestos-related lung cancer mesothelioma last year aged 55.

item.title: Instagram influencers over 50 show style is timeless
item.description: Over 50s influencers from around the world, including hijab-wearing, streetwear-donning 66-year-old Najate Leklye from Rotterdam, have taken Instagram by storm with their stylish posts.

item.title: Paul Burrell defends Prince William after claims Prince Harry branded him a 'snob'
item.description: Appearing on Good Morning Britain today via video link from his Cheshire home, Paul Burrell, 62, said that William is 'rational and calm' where Harry, 35, is 'fiery and hot'.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak hits caravan park in Shropshire as 21 residents are diagnosed with the disease
item.description: Testing began last week after three positive cases were confirmed at the site, which is in the town of Craven Arms. Twenty-one new cases of Covid-19 have been confirmed out of 41 people tested.

item.title: Ryanair announces a £168m loss but will keep flying to Spain
item.description: Ryanair said it suffered the 'most challenging' quarter in its 35-year history after carrying 500,000 passengers from April to June compared with 41.9million in the same period last year.

item.title: The wedding etiquette YOU should be following post-lockdown
item.description: While there will never be one blueprint that works for everyone, wedding experts have revaled to FEMAIL the new rules British brides and grooms should follow if they want the big day to go smoothly.

item.title: Stab victim found knifed to death in street as 19-year-old is charged with his murder
item.description: Joshua Harling, 19, was killed in Thame close to an upturned hatchback on Wednesday, with banknotes seen scattered across the ground nearby.

item.title: Blood test backlog means nearly 200 Commonwealth Army recruits face losing their visas
item.description: Nearly 200 Army recruits from the Commonwealth face being forced out of Britain next week after a huge backlog in blood tests delayed them joining up.

item.title: Ed Sheeran reveals he used to binge until sick but credits wife Cherry for helping him
item.description: The singer, 29, spoke candidly about his past, revealing that he used to binge on junk food and alcohol. Ed praised his wife Cherry for helping him to start making healthy choices.

item.title: Woman, 27, was left with excruciating burns on her buttocks after a radiator pipe EXPLODED
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Charlotte Beeton, 27, from Southampton, suffered an epileptic seizure and landed on a radiator pipe, which covered her lower body in boiling water.

item.title: Kate Garraway admits rubber was 'flying everywhere' after'utterly terrifying' tyre blowout
item.description: Kate Garraway has spoken for the first time about the 'utterly terrifying' moment her tyre blew out while she was driving on the motorway.

item.title: Ministers will discuss plans to offer dozens of Afghan interpreters sanctuary in Britain
item.description: Ministers will this week discuss plans to give dozens more Afghan interpreters sanctuary in Britain after being accused of repeatedly failing to deliver on their promises.

item.title: Two years after promise that 50 more interpreters could come to Britain, TWO have been allowed in
item.description: It was this unwavering loyalty to British troops by Waheed and many other Afghan interpreters that led former Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson to promise them sanctuary in the UK.

item.title: Meghan Markle 'set up photo opportunities with paparazzi when she worked on Suits'
item.description: Suits star Meghan Markle allegedly told photographers where she would be so they could get pictures and 'let info slip out to the press', bombshell biography Finding Freedom claims.

item.title: Jeep speeds through Colorado BLM march as demonstrator accidentally shoots two protesters
item.description: A Jeep drove through a Black Lives Matter march along Interstate 225 in Aurora, Colorado, Saturday, as a protesters opened fire with a gun and wounded at least two other demonstrators.

item.title: Economy will require extra 18 months to bounce back
item.description: Analysts have pushed back forecasts from early 2023 to late 2024, after data showed wary Britons spent less than expected on the High Street and at restaurants once lockdown began lifting.

item.title: Killing Eve season 4 postponed 'without a clear return date' due to COVID-19 travel restrictions
item.description: The fourth season of Killing Eve has been postponed as a consequence of the coronavirus pandemic and the travel restrictions it has imposed on the world.

item.title: Can you spot the rose? Puzzle reveals how our brains fail to recognise an object we don't expect
item.description: Psychologists at Harvard University worked with Babylon Health to create a visual experiment that challenges participants to find a single rose hidden in three busy images.

item.title: All over-40s could face higher taxes to fund cost of care - expected to soar by £7billion a year
item.description: All over-40s could be asked to pay more tax to help fund the cost of their care in later life under radical plans being discussed by ministers.

item.title: Union chief warns of 'serious industrial unrest' if ministers order civil servants to return to work
item.description: The hardline stance of the general secretary of the Public and Commercial Services Union threatens Boris Johnson's attempt to tackle 'backlog Britain'.

item.title: Protester shot dead at Austin protest was pushing quadruple amputee fiancee before he was shot
item.description: Garrett Foster has been identified as the man who was fatally shot at a protest in Austin when he approached a vehicle and the driver inside opened fire, police said.

item.title: Tuk-tuks could be coming to Britain after licence was granted for three-wheeler taxis in Cornwall
item.description: Tuk-tuks could be coming to Britain, after a licence was granted for the three-wheeler taxis to operate in Cornwall. The Swedish-made vehicles will have doors and be run on electricity.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Lifelong feud between Olivia De Havilland and her sister Joan
item.description: In 1942, Olivia De Havilland was Oscar nominated for Hold Back The Dawn - only to see her younger sister, Joan Fontaine, win for Suspicion.

item.title: Row breaks out on a bus in Liverpool over masks as driver forced to stop passengers arguing
item.description: A heated argument between a man, older woman and younger passenger broke out after the young woman was not wearing a mask on a bus in Liverpool.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: The real bombshell? How little Harry, not Meghan, grasped about the monarchy
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: How depressingly predictable that the authorised-but-not-authorised account of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's rupture with the Royals should rest on the charge of 'snobbery'.

item.title: 80,000 people will be evacuated from Vietnamese city after THREE cases of Covid-19 were recorded
item.description: The Southeast Asian country is back on high alert after the government on Saturday confirmed its first community infections since April, and another three cases on Sunday, all in or around Danang.

item.title: Princess Anne scoffs at The Crown actress playing her for taking two hours to perfect her haircut
item.description: Princess Anne admitted that she has seen The Crown and dubbed the earlier episodes 'quite interesting'. But Anne said she doesn't watch the show - depicting her mother's life - any longer.

item.title: Black bear takes a nap in a woman's kiddie pool after wandering into her backyard in Virginia
item.description: Regina Keller was watering the plants at her home near Fort Valley, Virginia, on July 19 when a large black bear unexpectedly wandered into her backyard and napped in her kiddie pool.

item.title: How Prince Harry was FIRST to say 'I love you'
item.description: Harry and Meghan felt a 'palpable attraction' after their first date at Dean Street Townhouse in Soho, London, with Harry left in a 'trance' , according to biography Finding Freedom.

item.title: Chancellor Rishi Sunak mulls taxing online sales to raise £2BILLION
item.description: With the High Street decimated amid the coronavirus lockdown and huge numbers of job cuts and store closures, the chancellor is looking at proposals to level the playing field.

item.title: Baby, two parents and a worker test positive to coronavirus in Melbourne Royal Children's Hospital
item.description: It comes as Victoria suffers a record 532 new cases of coronavirus as Premier Daniel Andrews threatens to shut down entire industries in the next stage of restrictions.

item.title: New York Attorney General slammed for approving proposed Harvey Weinstein settlement
item.description: Harvey Weinstein accusers and their lawyers are criticizing New York Attorney General Letitia James for signing off on a proposed settlement deal that 'gave victims' money' to the Weinstein brothers.

item.title: Arkansas Sen Tom Cotton calls slavery 'necessary evil' as he attacks New York Times' 1619 Project
item.description: Tom Cotton,a Republican, made the jarring remark in an interview on Sunday as he promoted a new bill that would defund schools that teach the New York Times' 1619 Project about slavery in the US.

item.title: Social media users share VERY unpleasant designs sure to make you cringe
item.description: Swedish Instagram account Ugly Designs shared hilarious photos of very unpleasant design flaws, including - an oyster themed manicure and a curtain designed to look like a pack of cigarettes.

item.title: Hilarious moment child interrupts his parent's interview on MSNBC before his sister drags him away
item.description: Award-winning author Masha Gessen's interview on MSNBC had two unexpected cameos from their children in a hilarious moment caught on TV on Sunday. Social media users loved the moment.

item.title: Robot can identify birds with around 90 per cent accuracy
item.description: The technology was trained using pictures of wild great tits and sociable weavers (pictured), as well as captive zebra finches.

item.title: JAN MOIR on the Meghan and Harry biography that has put the whinge into Windsor
item.description: JAN MOIR: Brace yourselves for bombshell revelations, such as the afternoon the Queen was too busy to see the Sussexes and they had to wait for an appointment like everyone else.

item.title: Fire, Water, Earth? For centuries mystics have used a special system to define your true nature
item.description: Jean Haner who has studied the spiritual side of Chinese medicine for nearly 40 years, reveals how understanding your Element has the potential to change your life.

item.title: Prince Charles was 'crushed' when Harry confirmed Meghan Markle was his girlfriend, biography claims
item.description: Prince Charles was left 'crushed' when Harry confirmed Meghan Markle was his girlfriend - as it overshadowed an official tour of the Middle East.

item.title: President Trump blames 'radical left anarchists' after federal agents are hit with explosives
item.description: President Trump on Sunday claimed 'Lamestream Media' was trying to portray 'radical left anarchists' as 'peaceful protesters' after explosives were fired at federal agents in Portland, Oregon

item.title: BBC is branded 'amateurish' over license fee letter timing
item.description: Around three million of the 4.5million UK viewers who are over 75 will no longer be exempt from the £157.50 fee from August.

item.title: Will Garmin pay $10 Million ransom in order to bring to an end ransomware attack after three days?
item.description: Garmin is being asked to pay a $10 million ransom after a cyberattack has taken down its systems and apps including its website for five days. Maksim Yakubets, 33, is believed to be behind it.

item.title: Dad's genius trick for turning leftover sandwich crusts into cinnamon scrolls
item.description: A father-of-two from Melbourne has shared his trick for turning leftover sandwich crusts into cinnamon scrolls, and parents across Australia have labelled it 'genius'.

item.title: Hundreds of unattended teenagers go on a destructive rampage at Memphis mini-golf center
item.description: Between 300 and 400 teenagers who were at a Memphis, Tennessee mini-golf complex ended up going berserk after staff refused a refund over a faulty games machine.

item.title: Former Playboy cover star and Summerfest executive Bo Black dies at 74
item.description: Bo Black died at 74 on Friday morning at her home in Scottsdale, Arizona, following a long decline in her health, according to her husband, former MLB manager Tom Trebelhorn.

item.title: Victoria is set to record 532 new cases of coronavirus
item.description: Deputy chief medical officer Nick Coatsworth said the lockdown should have brought case numbers down by now but coronavirus is 'deeply embedded' in Australia's second-biggest city.

item.title: Can you tell who's who in photos of A-list stars and their doppelganger daughters?
item.description: TANITH CAREY: With today's young girls looking so grown up, it's no wonder they start to meet their daughters in the middle.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS:A riotous sitcom with the funniest man on telly . . . what's not to love?
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: There may be a funnier comedian on television than Lee Mack but, if there is, I want to hear about it.

item.title: Lisa Marie Presley's ex-husband tells court he fears she'll relapse on drugs after son's suicide
item.description: Lisa Marie Presley's ex-husband Michael Lockwood filed court documents Thursday demanding she be stripped of pimary custody for fear she'll relapse after son's suicide.

item.title: Prince Harry 'ditched an old friend for criticising Meghan Markle', book claims
item.description: The Duke of Sussex dropped an old friend who had been making negative remarks about Meghan Markle soon after the couple's relationship began in 2016, the new book claims.

item.title: George Michael's sister Melanie Panayiotou's cause of death is 'finally confirmed as diabetic coma'
item.description: According to a new report, the former hairdresser passed away, aged 59, after falling into a diabetic coma as a result of diabetic ketoacidosis

item.title: Australian mother's enormous lockdown laundry pile is branded the most relatable photo this year
item.description: Perth mum Kodie Quinlivan couldn't face folding laundry during lockdown. The enormous pile she created instead has been branded the most relatable post on social media this year.

item.title: Scandal and splendour... it's like an Indian Dynasty: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews A Suitable Boy
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Fans of Dynasty might be forgiven for feeling that A Suitable Boy (BBC1) had a familiar flavour, even though it is set in the fictional Indian city of Brahmpur.

item.title: Princess Mary and Prince Frederik are seen in rare candid pictures from their summer holiday
item.description: The Danish royals enjoyed some rare downtime as they frolicked at the beach on their summer holiday last week. Princess Mary and her family have spent time in Skagen, in Denmark.

item.title: Should you tell a new partner if you have cheated in a past relationship?
item.description: An Australian dating coach has polled the public about whether you should tell your new partner if you cheated in a previous relationship.

item.title: Boy 17, is stabbed to death following street fight in Manchester
item.description: A 17-year-old boy was murdered and three others were stabbed during a fight in the Moss Side area of Manchester at 7,30pm yesterday. Three other teenagers also suffered stab wounds .

item.title: Large companies with no female executive committee members 'missed out on £47 billion last year'
item.description: Firms listed on the FTSE 100 and FTSE 250 that had no women on their executive committees missed out on £47billion last year, according to The Pipeline.

item.title: Four people are air-lifted to hospital after eight swimmers swept away by rip-tides
item.description: Emergency services were called to the village of Aberdyfi in Gwynedd, North Wales at around 2.15pm on Sunday after reports that eight people had got into difficulty in the sea.

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE: Ex-deputy takes her revenge on 'Squeaker' John Bercow
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: Sensationally, John Bercow is the first Speaker in 230 years not to be draped in ermine after vacating the Commons chair.

item.title: My lightbulb moment: Popcorn maker Jackie Sopher, reveals the inspiration behind her business
item.description: Jackie Sopher, 58, founded Joe & Seph's Gourmet Popcorn with her husband Joe, 62, in 2010. The mother-of-three revealed their inspiration came from the flavoured popcorn sold in the U.S.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN: Harry and Meghan are just hell-bent on finding offence everywhere
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Apparently, it was this year's Commonwealth Day service at Westminster Abbey that was the final straw for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

item.title: After Prince Harry and Meghan Markle biography's explosive claims, royal insiders give THEIR side
item.description: Finding Freedom contains score-settling and vicious swipes at the Royal Family, courtiers and the media. Here, the Mail outlines some of the most astonishing allegations.

item.title: Is it just me? Or are fancy taps a faff? asks LIZ HOGGARD
item.description: British writer Liz Hoggard, who recently struggled to use a solid-brass, swan-shaped mixer tap, says smart taps in restaurant and hotel bathrooms are the very devil.

item.title: Pressure builds on millionaire farmer Ben Goldsmith in row over 'releasing deer and wild boar'
item.description: Ben Goldsmith, 39, is under rising pressure over his role as a non-executive board member at DEFRA after it was revealed he allegedly broke rules by releasing red deer and wild boar.

item.title: You can bloom with tree bark beauty: It's a natural source of anti-ageing ingredients
item.description: Anna Maxted gives her verdict on six products with beautifying bark extract available to purchase in the UK. Tree barks contain powerful antioxidants that can promote skin health.

item.title: Branding William a 'snob' is unjust but shows the deep chasm between the brothers, says RICHARD KAY
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Just what was going through Prince William's mind when he sat down with his brother to discuss Harry's fast-moving romance with actress Meghan Markle?

item.title: I'm writing my will and worried my sons aren't mine
item.description: An anonymous man asked British TV's Steph and Dom Parker for advice. He explained that he wants his sons to take a DNA test, because he wants to exclude them from his will, if he isn't their father.

item.title: To my shame, I put booze before my baby
item.description: British author Bryony Gordon, who built a reputation as a mental health campaigner while struggling with alcoholism, has penned a book about how she became sober.

item.title: How to dress like a grown up with Shane Watson: Jump for joy! The summer onesie is all you need
item.description: Shane Watson took inspiration from Cindy Crawford for embracing the seasonal trend for onesies. The British style expert says jumpsuits are best paired with low-heeled sandals or trainers.

item.title: Raffia revolution! FEMAIL picks out the best of the new style for embracing the seasonal trend
item.description: Alexandria Dale picked out a selection of the best raffia items for embracing this season's biggest fashion trend. The British style expert said the pieces are perfect for a picnic or the pub.

item.title: Half a million Britons increased their drinking to dangerous levels since lockdown began
item.description: Half a million adults have increased their drinking to severely dangerous levels since lockdown began, official figures suggest. Data shows that 550,562 people have increased consumption in lockdown.

item.title: Divorce numbers surged by almost a QUARTER in the 12 months before lockdown
item.description: There was a 23 per cent increase in the number of finalised divorces in the 12 months before lockdown, figures obtained by the Mail show.

item.title: The secret to finding a man in midlife? Write a love list!
item.description: Sophia Money-Coutts, 35, has penned a novel about a 32-year-old who has never had a boyfriend. The British author shares her own experience of speaking to love coaches in the hopes of romance.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Corporate Britain blind to debt
item.description: One worrying parallel with the financial crisis is that taxpayers are on the hook for billions of pounds of potential losses again, just as we were back then.

item.title: Heartbreaking Facebook post of boy, 18, who was found dead year after girlfriend was killed by bus
item.description: James Fincher, 18, was reported missing from an address in Coalville, north west Leicestershire, at 3.55pm on Saturday.

item.title: Westminster Abbey loses more than £12million in revenue this year in 'shattering blow'
item.description: Westminster Abbey is down more than £12million in revenue after its finances have taken a hit amid the coronavirus crisis, dean of Westminster Abbey, Very Reverend Dr David Hoyle said.

item.title: Prince Harry felt Prince Charles valued his own public image above their relationship, book reveals
item.description: The Duke of Sussex felt the Prince of Wales put the British public's opinions of him above anything else, according to bombshell biography Finding Freedom.

item.title: Tributes paid to boy, 8, killed crossing the road in Manchester
item.description: Safiullah Asif was killed as he crossed the road in Ashton-Under-Lyne on Thursday night. A 33-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving.

item.title: Heart-stopping moment teenage daredevil, 19, risks his life for a selfie scaling 500ft bridge
item.description: Adam Lockwood, 19, and three friends posed for selfies at the top of Forth Road Bridge, which towers around 500ft above the River Forth in central Scotland.

item.title: Romanian brothers jailed for 30 years for sex trafficking
item.description: Ilcic Dumitru, 19, left, and his 24-year-old brother Ioan, right, were jailed for a combined total of 31 years at Woolwich Crown Court after being convicted of controlling prostitution and modern slavery.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths in UK hospitals rise by 10 - the second lowest Sunday increase
item.description: There were 13 more fatalities in England, one in Wales, while Scotland had none for a tenth day in a row. Northern Ireland often does not update its total on a weekend.

item.title: An alfresco August for staycationers: Drive-in cinemas, a 100mph zip-wire line and Dark Sky forests
item.description: Every week Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing the legwork so you don't have to. This week: summertime specials making UK staycations better than ever.

item.title: Fin-tastic! Moment kayaker comes within feet of three enormous minke whales off the Devon coast
item.description: Rupert Kirkwood, 60, was greeted by the whales while paddling off coast of Plymouth, Devon. He said he had never seen so many whales before. The 60-year-old also saw some dolphins and porpoises.

item.title: New book claims 'no titles' were used as the Queen played peacekeeper with Prince Harry
item.description: Extracts of the biography, which are being serialised this weekend, detail the intimate lunch between the prince and the Queen on March 1, where the royals were just 'granny and grandson'.

item.title: Courtiers resented having to serve 'an actress on a cable show', bombshell book claims
item.description: Senior courtiers in other households - the so-called men in grey suits - did what they could to reign in the popularity of Harry and Meghan (pictured), the book claims.
